text:
I have an application running on a Win2k machine using Tomcat.  It contains a 
jsp page that displays several graphs of data using Batik 1.1.1.  The 
application has been running for months (on 1.0 Batik) and I recently upgraded 
to the 1.1.1 version.  

The problem is that every so often I get the following error and one of the 
many graphs will not be created:
-------
SVGRasterizer.writeImage(): General Error: org.w3c.dom.DOMException: An
element of type "text" has an invalid inline style: An error occurred
while parsing the following style declaration: text-anchor:end;
font-family:Verdana; fill:black; font-size:9.0
-------
Again it's only with one of the graphs and if I refresh the page, it usually 
will display fine.  I would estimate that 1/25 times I receive a graph error, 
and keep in mind that that is drawing a dozen or so graphs each time. I'm not 
even certain the problem is due to the upgrade since it is so infrequent.

I posted this to the Batik list and received the following response:
------
That is a known threading problem. That occurs in this file:
CSSOMStyleDeclaration.java

At these two lines:
ValueFactory f = factories.get(name.toLowerCase().intern());
f.createCSSValue(value, CSSOMStyleDeclaration.this, imp);
------

Hope that helps,
Tony
creator: ashawver@actaview.com
